Sentencas: The co-electrolysis of CO2 and H2O in high temperature solid oxide electrolysis cells (SOECs) is a promising energy storage method for intermittent renewable energy sources.
Titulo: Dynamic behavior and control strategy study of CO2/H2O co-electrolysis in solid oxide electrolysis cells

Sentencas: In this paper, a three-dimensional (3D) continuum model of a 3-kW 40-cell planar SOEC stack is employed to study the dynamic behavior and control strategy under variable working conditions.
Titulo: Dynamic behavior and control strategy study of CO2/H2O co-electrolysis in solid oxide electrolysis cells

Sentencas: The dynamic responses of stack power, current density, output H-2/CO ratio and stack temperature are evaluated for a scaled real-time wind power input over a whole day.
Titulo: Dynamic behavior and control strategy study of CO2/H2O co-electrolysis in solid oxide electrolysis cells

Sentencas: The fluctuation of the wind power input leads to SOEC stack temperature fluctuation, which illustrates the need for temperature control.
Titulo: Dynamic behavior and control strategy study of CO2/H2O co-electrolysis in solid oxide electrolysis cells

Sentencas: Two representative cases with voltage step changes in both endothermic and exothermic operation modes are studied to predict the temperature control by the variation of excess air ratio.
Titulo: Dynamic behavior and control strategy study of CO2/H2O co-electrolysis in solid oxide electrolysis cells

Sentencas: The effects of excess air ratio on both the steady-state temperature gradient and the transient temperature variation rate are analyzed in both cases.
Titulo: Dynamic behavior and control strategy study of CO2/H2O co-electrolysis in solid oxide electrolysis cells

Sentencas: The temperature fluctuation is successfully controlled by applying an excess air ratio profile that changes with the wind power input.
Titulo: Dynamic behavior and control strategy study of CO2/H2O co-electrolysis in solid oxide electrolysis cells
